examples: My health has always been delicate.
The matter requires delicate handling.
His mission was a delicate one.
Please don't joke about such a delicate subject.
He had fine delicate features.
Let us learn then to have a delicate conscience.
His conduct is precise and delicate, never overblown.
the delicate flavor of the wine
The tomb was adorned with delicate carvings.
She was a graceful young woman with delicate features.
The politician tried to slide over the delicate subject.
My chief reason for quoting these delicate lines.
The flower's petals are lacy and delicate.
Rosie's fingers traced a delicate pattern in the sand.
The meal included a delicate fish perfumed with butter and herbs.
a plant with delicate, lacy leaves
Edward III was in a delicate and unenviable position.
doctors using a laser to perform delicate eye surgery
a tree whose delicate beauty belies its real toughness
the painting's delicate nuances of color, tone, and texture
The hoarfrost formed a delicate swirly pattern on the window.
His delicate hand seemed fitter for the distaff than the spear.
For this delicate eye operation, seek out an experienced eye surgeon.
a guarded man who knew better than to reveal such delicate information
Pare off the skin of this fruit very gently, as the flesh is delicate.
The walls of the living room had a delicate vine stencil drawn on them.
The light of the setting sun tinges the buildings with delicate colours.
Delicate Ariel, I'll set thee free for this. (W. Shakespeare, The Tempest)
Temperature changes could upset the delicate balance of life in the forest.
The delicate taste of the wine was overpowered by the spiciness of the food.

Основная причина, по которой я цитирую эти изысканные строки.
